Description: Neck, shoulder and handle sherd of Chian two-handled pottery jar with horizontal reflex handle; white slip (very worn); interior reserved; exterior: on neck, vertical tongue pattern alternating black and white; below on shoulder, part of possible palmette; vertical bars on left side of handle; the right side glazed, then undetermined decoration on the part applied to shoulder.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924,1201.179 and 1924,1201.181. For parallels regarding the shape, see Lemos no. 1641 from Rizari and no. 1647 from Olbia. Similar is a piece from Emporio, Boardman, Greek Emporio no.844.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2158) (phase 2)
